question: If <katex>$\vec{a}$</katex> b, <katex>$\vec{c}$</katex> are three non-coplanar vectors and p, q, r are vectors defined by... <katex>$(\vec{a}+\vec{b}).\vec{p}+(\vec{b}+\vec{c}).\vec{q}+(\vec{c}+\vec{a}).\vec{r}$</katex> is
explanation: Sum of dot products in reciprocal system is <katex>$1+1+1 = 3$</katex>.
